message.content:
We only need to sum up all “Depreciation”‐type transactions in order to know how much depreciation has been accumulated by the end of the period. In our new problem there are two depreciation transactions:

• On 2024‑01‑01 a “Depreciation” record for 45,754.64 (the number shows as 45754.63999999999)  
• On 2024‑02‑01 a “Depreciation” record for 45,750.41

There is usually no “accumulated depreciation” carried from the opening (i.e. the “initial” accumulated depreciation is zero).

Thus:
 Initial Accumulated Depreciation = 0.00  
 Final (End) Accumulated Depreciation = 45,754.64 + 45,750.41 = 91,505.05

Below is the answer in the required json format.

--------------------------------------------------

{"solution": {"Accumulated Depreciation Initial Value": "0.00", "Accumulated Depreciation End Value": "91505.05"}}
